column4: hi, can someone tell me if i need to define a swap partition in Breezy Badger?
i'm using this guide: http://www.pcmech.com/show/os/903/ not sure if it is out of date
it's usually a good idea, how much RAM do you have?
i can't seem to figure out how to define a partition as swap according to the above guide, the options are different...
can i just skip the swap partition for now?
the installer will create a swap partition by default
oh, so i just leave it some free space?
maybe i should find another guide
iirc it will offer to use the free space and create 2 partitions in it - one swap and one for /
oh yeah, it just did that :)
indeed, i wonder why http://www.pcmech.com/show/os/903/ makes it so complicated
hm, it seems to be referring to a 2 drive setup
i think IDE1 master in that config is all windows... looks like 1 drive for linux, 1 for windows
